content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia function you asked for:
```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)::AbstractString
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ _-]+" => "_")
end
```
This function takes a string `col` as input and returns the same string, but after it has been transformed according to your specifications: all characters are converted to lower case, leading or trailing spaces are removed, and multiple consecutive spaces and hyphens are replaced with a single underscore.
